name: VM
overview:
This class allows you interact with Google Compute Engine.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var gce = gcloud.compute();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var gce = gcloud.compute({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: VM
methods.description: An Instance object allows you to interact with a Google Compute Engine instance.

examples.code:
var zone = gce.zone('zone-name');

var vm = zone.vm('vm-name');

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

examples.code: vm.exists(function(err, exists) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get a virtual machine if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

examples.code: vm.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: Provide an options object to customize the request.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.readOnly
params.description: • Attach the disk in read-only mode. (Alias for options.mode = READ_ONLY)

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

params.description: • The device name of the disk to detach. If a Disk object is provided, we try to find the device name automatically by searching through the attached disks on the instance.

methods.name: getSerialPortOutput
methods.description: Returns the serial port output for the instance.

examples.code: vm.getSerialPortOutput(function(err, output, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: port
params.description: • The port from which the output is retrieved (1-4). Default: 1.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: getTags
methods.description:
Get the instance's tags and their fingerprint.

This method wraps compute/vm#getMetadata, returning only the tags property.

examples.code: vm.getTags(function(err, tags, fingerprint, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: resize
methods.description:
Set the machine type for this instance, stopping and restarting the VM as necessary.

For a list of the standard, high-memory, and high-CPU machines you may choose from, see Predefined machine types">https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/machine-types#predefined_machine_types}.

In order to change the machine type, the VM must not be running. This method will automatically stop the VM if it is running before changing the machine type. After it is sucessfully changed, the VM will be started.

examples.caption: By default, calling resize will start your server after updating its machine type. If you want to leave it stopped, set options.start to false.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: machineType
params.description: • Full or partial machine type. See a list of predefined machine types here.

params.name: options.start
params.description: • Start the VM after successfully updating the machine type. Default: false.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.
